Sure! Here are some effective ways to engage your audience once they enroll in your course and keep them motivated throughout:

1. Foster a sense of community: Create a private online community for your course members where they can interact, share their thoughts, ask questions, and support each other. This community can be in the form of a private Facebook group, Slack channel, or forum.

2. Deliver the course in digestible chunks: Break down the course content into manageable modules and lessons, rather than overwhelming them with information, and release them at regular intervals.

3. Provide interactive and engaging content: Mix up your content with quizzes, activities, discussions, and case studies, to make the content more interactive and engaging.

4. Personalize your communication: Address your audience by their names in communication messages, write in an informal tone to create a comfortable learning environment, and respond promptly to their queries.

5. Offer regular updates and feedback: Provide regular updates on course progress, new content, or live sessions, and provide feedback on their progress, whether through automatic feedback or personalized grading.

6. Inspire accountability: Encourage accountability by providing timelines and deadlines for tasks and quizzes, and offer certificates or badges to recognize their progress.

7. Host live sessions: Offer live sessions, webinars, or Q&A sessions where learners can interact with you and their peers, ask questions, and clarify doubts.

By implementing these strategies, you can keep your audience engaged and committed to your course until the end.
